snippet: A British company cannot sell merchandise under the name “Knut — Der Eisbär” (German for “Knut — the polar bear”), a European court ruled Monday.
abstract: General Court of the European Union rules that a British company cannot sell merchandise under the name 'Knut--Der Eisbar,' which is German for 'Knut--the polar bear,' closing yet another chapter in the unusual saga of the Berlin Zoo's late animal celebrity; marketing the bear has proved especially lucrative for the zoo.
lead_paragraph: A British company cannot sell merchandise under the name “Knut — Der Eisbär” (German for “Knut — the polar bear”), a European court ruled Monday.
